benchmark_details.name: SHIELD AGENT -BENCH
benchmark_details.overview: SHIELD AGENT -BENCH is the first comprehensive benchmark for evaluating guardrails for LLM-based autonomous agents, encompassing safe and risky trajectories across six diverse web environments.
benchmark_details.data_type: safety-related pairs of agent instructions and action trajectories

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: Evaluate the effectiveness of guardrails for LLM-based autonomous agents.

data.source: Safety-related instructions and trajectories generated via attacks on LLM-based agents.

methodology.calculation: Measured the effectiveness of guardrails using both accuracy and efficiency metrics.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy and lower false positive rates indicate more effective guardrail mechanisms.
methodology.baseline_results: Compared against existing benchmarks such as ST-WebAgentBench, VWA-Adv, and AgentHarm.
methodology.validation: Extensive experiments demonstrating performance across various risk scenarios.

targeted_risks.harm: The benchmark aims to mitigate safety risks in LLM-based agents.
